passages.text: Autoliv, Inc. ALV| \(\) 125.35\(Outperform | Target Price/Base Case:\) \ \(140.00\) Company Update
Market Capitalization (M) \(\) 10,680\(Enterprise Value (M)\) \ \(11,035\) Shares Outstanding (M) 76.7Adj Net Debt (M) \(\) 1,422\(52 - Week Range\) \ \(75.49 -\) 125.65Fiscal Year End Dec

20242025E2026ERevenue (M)FY$10,391$10,748EBITDA (M)FY$1,394$1,512EBIT (M)FY$1,007$1,107EPSFY$8.32$9.65Consensus EPSFY$8.32$9.35Div/shrFY2.723.10FCF (M)FY$496$683FCF/shrFY$6.47$8.90EV/RevenueFY1.061.03EV/EBITDAFY7.927.30P/EFY15.113.0

PM Summary - This week, we took EvrlSI best- idea stalwart and Scandi mission- critical safety component supplier Autoliv (CFO/IR) for a pre- Labor Day showing and to get messaging and outlook around Q3 & 2026.

What we heard was solid, consistent messaging (in line with June CMD & other recent August conference appearances), along with some additional modeling nuggets & things to look out for as we progress through the remainder of 2025.

Major topics of discussion were of course: 1) LVP (and ++ revisions), 2) CPV/GoM growth today (short & long- term), 3) Margin guidance and incremental/operating leverage, as well as 4) New Products and a discussion on future opportunities in an Auto 3.0 world...
See inside for this week's ALV learnings, margin levers, and medium- term outlook as we head into a crucial 2H'25 and look forward to '26 & '27...

Please see the analyst certification and important disclosures on page 12 of this report. Evercore ISI and affiliates do and seek to do business with companies covered in its research reports. Investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. © 2025. Evercore Group L.L.C. All rights reserved.
Over two days with ALV in NYC & Boston, we heard a few recurring themes on Rev, Margins and Outlook for '25 & '26...
At a high level, the 3 key buckets to reach \(^{**}4 - 6\%\) " steady state organic Rev over the course of the decade are:

1. \(1 - 2\%\) from LVP growth 
2. \(1 - 2\%\) from CPV/GoM growth 
3. \(1 - 2\%\) from non-core activities increasing (commercial, two wheelers, etc.)

Production - post \(^{+ + }\) NA revisions from IHS, the independent forecasters are now \(+1\%\) YoY (flatish weighted) YoY vs ALV's \(- 0.5\%\) guidance assumption, some clear potential upside to their Rev guide now exists. Despite the \(1 - 1.5\%\) cushion in their guide, ALV said they will reevaluate their \(+3\%\) organic framework \((- 0.5\%\) production and \(+3.5\%\) GoM) on Q3 with solid confidence in the outgrowth (no Mix issues). If production moves to \(+0.5 - 1\%\) , then ALV may raise their FY Rev by \(+1\%\) or \(\) 100\mathrm{MM}\$

Autoliv remains steady on market share at \(- 44 - 45\%\) , not losing out to major competition, with share "as high as it's ever been". Management was adamant that ALV's product is differentiated and has a design & development moat that cannot be easily replicated in any scale over the near- term.

GoM Mid- term - can \(+3 - 4\%\) growth HOLD ON in '26? Very dependent on MIX... When lower content regions like China, Asia ex- Japan, Africa, etc. grow faster than higher content regions like NA, it creates a headwind. CFO did note that there is "decent content growth in all regions", with India continuing to command a larger share of ALV's revenue, now about \(5\%\) . Our works shows the mix headwind may slightly abate in 2H and '26 based on China comps/pre- buy.
Q3, as guided now (key asterisk), may be a confirmed "low point on margins" (either means \(

Extra cost benefits in \(20\) from Automation - Another \(\) 30- 35\mathrm{MM}$ remains in ALV costcutting program over new two years ( \(\) 100\mathrm{MM}$ executed so far), encompassing white- collar and direct labor reduction (2k and 6k heads, respectively), automation savings, and other labor efficiency.

We feel confident in our early read of an \(11\%\) '26 margin (as initial guide), with upside case for FY25 likely in the \(10.3 - 10.4\%\) range if production holds up and sees some \(++\) revisions.

Repurchases continuing (trending \(\sim 23k\) shares/day per ALV website), largely in the stated range of \(\) 300- 500\mathrm{M}\mathrm{/}\mathrm{yr}\(. ALV can go above and beyond the high - end of this number should conditions prove correct, and to hit the\) \ \(2.5\mathrm{Bn}\) total authorized amount in 4.5yrs would require a 12- month period above \(\) 500\mathrm{MM}\$

Potential for BYD & other domestic Chinese to use full ALV systems vs strictly the inflator component for international sales, a 3- 4x CPV opportunity on those vehicles ( \(\) 150- 200\(vs\) \ \(30 - 40\) ). ALV currently working on the RFP process for these opportunities that could provide tailwind helping to offset LVP mix.

BYD mix is still difficult due to the relative lack of content on domestic BYD vehicles, meaning when BYD outperforms global LVP, ALV does worse, although \(2\mathrm{H}25\) in China should provide a meaningful inflection where ALV underperformed by \(9\%\) in 1H.
China development cycles remain RAPID, with vehicles launching in China next year not yet locked in on who suppliers are in some cases...

Incremental tariffs are a \(\) 100\mathrm{MM}\$ headwind which is largely passed- through to customers; ALV has a \(27.5\%\) tariff on non- USMCA compliant parts currently, with a reduction to \(15\%\) taking gross tariff exposure down significantly (allowing for less pass- through and slightly better total mgn).
Outperform, PT \(\) 140\(\) 18- month target of \(\) 160- 170\(on'27 EPS of\) \sim \S 14\$

Low- Beta exposure to global & EU Volume Auto Cycle - Our top pick (alongside BWA) among the "bread & butter" legacy suppliers with \(+4 - 6\%\) longer- term organic growth. ALV sells airbags & seatbelts which will be less hampered by hiccups in the pace of the global EV transition potentially representing a sentiment headwind for other higher growth suppliers (ALV does have slightly higher content, on avg, with EVs). ALV is a dominant \(\sim 44\%\) market share en route to \(45 - 48\%\) mid/late decade & is also diversified across nextgen, domestic Chinese (OK BYD exposure of \(1\%\) of Rev and growing) & J3 so there is almost no "mix" that is negative to CPV trends.

Idiosyncratic Margin Story - Outside of pure volumes (all suppliers levered to production when we infect 1H '26 on US/EU), ALV also has one of the best idiosyncratic margin stories through the combo of labor reductions, automation, improved visibility into customer production, & pricing recoveries (the latter \(100\%\) flow through to EBIT). '25 EBIT margin guide of \(10 - 10.5\%\) should be a continued step towards ALV's medium- term target of \(12\%\) (we take as '27 optimistic, '28 fallback) dependent on LVP of \(>85\mathrm{MM}\) units (IHS equivalent 89MM units). ALV achieving \(\sim 11\%\) '26 EBIT is \(\sim \$ 11.50 - 12\) EPS. At ALV's June CMD (one of best in years for the sector) - the firm's addressed the next 5- 10yrs through 3 main drivers of 1) Organic growth \(+4 - 6\%\) for next 10yrs!, 2) Mgn of \(12\%\) "mid- term" & 3) Capital allocation (\$400- 600MM buyback/yr) which could drive \(\) 15- 17\('28 EPS (stock 7 - 8x PE on those numbers vs average 10 - 14x PE).

Market Share and Outgrowth - ALV has guided for \(+4 - 6\%\) organic growth for next 10 years based on long- term adoption trends of higher passive safety content (side/rear airbags), China/RoW content currently at half the levels of EU/US, market/TAM extensions into scooters/bikes, & market share gains to the \(45\% +\) level. We believe \(1 - 2\%\) of the \(+4 - 6\%\) is from assumed production growth. ALV has \(\sim 44\%\) market share globally (TRW/ZF 2nd highest in similar \(\sim 40\%\) share) but last 5 yrs order share in the high 40s to \(50\%\) range will drive share gains through '27.

Valuation - ALV has had a volatile year (topping off \(\) 129\(last year and bottoming\) \ \(80\) and currently sits at the upper/middle \(10x\) PE of its \(7 - 13x\) '26 range. Last 18 months RR of \(\) 70- 130\(. We see ALV as a\) \ \(130+\) stock exiting this year, \(\) 140\(by Q1'26 and possibly a\) \ \(150+\) stock looking to '27 on cycle/margin/ownership/multiple expansion. On a 2- 3yr basis, ALV could peak at \(\) 170- 180\(on 11 - 12x\) \ \(16\) EPS '28 in \(2+\) years.
Figure 1: ALV Guidance Summary vs EvrlSI & Cons Estimates
Source:ALVJune'25Capital MarketsDay,EvercoreISlResearch
Figure 2: ALV's Historical PE Multiple has trended with Swedish Ownership
Source:CompanyData,EvercoreISlResearch
Best CMD ChartsALV hosted one of the best CMDs in recent Supplier- history back in June... These are some of the larger takeaways and helpful charts.

Lower Global LVP Headwinds from supplier cost inflation Additional cost savings from structural and strategic initiatives Higher cost for certain raw materials, mainly in the U.S. Contrary to the past three years we do not expect a gradual quarter- by- quarter adjusted operating margin increase due to a different inflationary environment. However, the fourth quarter is still anticipated to be the strongest of the year.
We successfully navigated tariffs in the first quarter, giving us confidence for the remainder of the year
Full Year 2025 Guidance¹Organic sales increase²Around 2%Adjusted Operating margin²Around 10 to 10.5%Operating Cash flow³Around $1.2 billionCapex, net % of salesAround 5%

(1) Our full year 2025 guidance is based on our customer call-offs, as well as the achievement of our targeted cost compensation adjustments with our customers including for the new tariffs, no further material changes to tariffs or trade restrictions that are in effect as of June 3, 2025, as well as no significant changes in the macro-economic environment, changes in customer call-off volatility or significant supply chain disruptions. (2) Non- US GAAP excluding effects from capacity alignment and antitrust related matters (3) Excluding unusual items
Source: ALV June '25 Capital Markets Day, Evercore ISI Research

In 2024, Autoliv globally paid approximately \(100 million in customs & duties. This is included in commercial terms Currently, we estimate that the additional tariffs on steel, aluminum, and non- USMCA compliant parts could amount to \(\sim\) 100 million annually We are working closely with our customers and suppliers to minimize the impact of tariffs In Q1'25, we were successfully compensated for the new U.S. tariffs, and our ambition and expectation is that this will continue to be the case
Figure 4: Tariff impact could grow if increased steel & aluminium tariffs remain
Source: ALV June '25 Capital Markets Day, Evercore ISI Research
Figure 5: – LONG TERM 5/10yr guide & buyback are ++ on the story for an ALV which could be a “high-teens compounding” industrial.
Source: ALV June '25 Capital Markets Day, Evercore ISI Research
Source: ALV June '25 Capital Markets Day, Evercore ISI Research

VALUATION METHODOLOGYIn general, we derive our target prices using industrial multiples, Sum of the Parts, EV/EBITDA and P/E, either in combination or isolation. We consider automotive valuations in a global context as well as relative to companies' own histories. We assess future earnings growth, operating margins, free cash flow generation and returns on capital employed when determining whether a company is deserving of higher or lower multiples.

RISKSAutomotive companies are global, cyclically exposed, highly complex businesses. As a result, they are exposed to both positive and negative risks from broader political, economic and social factors. They also face both operational and execution risk, as well as risks from changes in key personnel. Any failure to adequately assess exposure to such risks in a timely fashion may result in our estimates/forecasts proving too high and/or too low.

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
\*Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
